IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE ORGANIZATION PROVIDES HOUSING, FOOD AND ACTIVITIES TO MENTALLY CHALLENGED RESIDENTS IN A CONGREGATE LIVING FACILITY. CURRENTLY THE PROGRAM SERVES 15 RESIDENTS.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: JOHN KELLEHER CPA CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: WORC HAVEN, INC.'S PERSONNEL ARE EMPLOYED BY SUNRISE COMMUNITY, INC., A RELATED 501(C)(3) ORGANIZATION. SUNRISE COMMUNITY INC. USES THE FOLLOWING TO ESTABLISH COMPENSATION FOR UNITED CEREBRAL PALSY OF TAMPA BAY, INC.'S CEO: FORM 990 OF OTHER ORGANZIATIONS, COMPENSATION SURVEY OR STUDY, AND APPROVAL BY THE BOARD OR COMPENSATION COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOLE MEMBER OF THE ORGANIZATION IS SUNRISE COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S SOLE MEMBER, SUNRISE COMMUNITY SERVICES, INC., HAS THE AUTHORITY TO ELECT MEMBERS OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AT A MEETING OF MEMBERS CALLED EXPRESSLY FOR THAT PURPOSE, ANY DIRECTOR OR THE ENTIRE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MAY BE REMOVED, WITH OR WITHOUT CAUSE, BY A VOTE OF A MAJORITY OF THE MEMBERS THEN ENTITLED TO VOTE AT AN ELECTION OF DIRECTORS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE CONDUCTS A COMPREHENSIVE REVIEW OF THE FORM 990 BEFORE IT IS FILED. A COPY OF THE RETURN, AS ULTIMATELY FILED, IS PROVIDED TO EACH VOTING MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BEFORE IT IS FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION'S CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY COVERS ALL EMPLOYEES, EXECUTIVES, TRUSTEES AND BOARD MEMBERS. THE PRESIDENT & CEO MONITORS AND ENFORCES COMPLIANCE WITH THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FINANCE COMMITTEE CONDUCTS A COMPREHENSIVE REVIEW OF THE FORM 990 BEFORE IT IS FILED. A COPY OF THE RETURN, AS ULTIMATELY FILED, IS PROVIDED TO EACH VOTING MEMBER OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS BEFORE IT IS FILED WITH THE IRS.
NET ASSETS TRANSFERRED FROM RELATED ENTITIES 42,976.

OVERSIGHT OF AUDIT AND SELECTION OF INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTANT: THE AUDIT COMMITTEE IS RESPONSIBLE FOR THE SELECTION, MONITORING AND EVALUATION OF AN INDEPENDENT AUDIT FIRM AND OVERSIGHT OF THE AUDIT OF ITS FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.

NET ASSET TRANSFERS FROM (TO) RELATED PARTIES: THE SUNRISE GROUP'S CASH MANAGEMENT POLICIES REQUIRE ALL CASH RECEIPTS TO BE TRANSFERRED TO THE SUNRISE COMMUNITY, INC. GENERAL OPERATING ACCOUNT. CASH TRANSFERS BACK TO THE ORGANIZATION ARE ONLY MADE TO COVER ITS REQUIRED CASH FLOW NEEDS, CREATING A DUE FROM (TO) SUNRISE COMMUNITY, INC. SINCE THERE IS NO INTENTION TO REPAY THESE RELATED-PARTY BALANCES, ANY EXCESS CASH TRANSFERS ARE CONSIDERED A PERMANENT TRANSFER OF NET ASSETS AT YEAR-END. DURING THE YEAR ENDED JUNE 30, 2018, THE ORGANIZATION TRANSFERRED NET ASSETS FROM ENTITIES IN THE SUNRISE GROUP AMOUNTING TO $42,976.
